required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tailored Information About the Coronavirus in Chronic Kidney Disease Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Tailored Information About the Coronavirus and the Coronavirus Pandemic for Patients With Chronic Kidney Disease

brief_summary.textblock: Randomized clinical trial focusing on the effect of tailored information on Covid-19 for patients with chronic kidney disease on health literacy, anxiety and self-perceived health.

detailed_description.textblock: This single-center randomized open clinical trial in persons with chronic kidney disease stage 4-5, investigates the effect of information about coronavirus specifically targeted for the study population on digital, functional, interactive and critical health literacy, fear of coronavirus and self-perceived health. The intervention is information videos followed by a teach-back procedure. Patients are followed for 3 months.

primary_outcome.description: Digital health literacy measured by Electronic Health Literacy Scale (shortened eHEALS, Norman et al 2006), a questionnaire composed of 8 items measuring combined knowledge, comfort, and perceived skills at finding, evaluating, and applying electronic health information to health problems, Likert scale 1 (lowest, worst digital health literacy) - 5 (highest, best digital health literacy), with max score 40.

secondary_outcome.description: Health literacy measured by Health Literacy Questionnaire (shortened HLQ, Osborne et al 2013), a questionnaire composed of 44 items (9 dimensions) measuring reading and writing skills (functional), interactive and critical literacy. Likert scale 1 (lowest, worst health literacy) - 4 (highest, best health literacy) for some items and 1 (lowest, similar) - 5 (highest) for other items with calculations of mean score for each of the 9 dimensions.

Self-perceived health measured with the EQ-5D-5L (EuroQol Group 1990), a questionnaire composed of 5 items / dimensions (mobility, autonomy, daily activities, pain, and anxiety and depression), Likert scale 1 (lowest / best health) - 5 (highest / worst health) with max score 25
Anxiety / concern measured by the questionnaire Fear of corona scale (Ahorsu et al 2020), Likert scale 1 (lowest, least concern) - 5 (highest, most concern) with max score 35

arm_group.description: Tailored information about coronavirus using information videos followed by a teach-back procedure
Controls have access to information videos, but do not receive the teach-back procedure (the intervention)

intervention.description: Tailored information about coronavirus for patients with chronic kidney disease by information videos followed by a teach back procedure

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Chronic kidney disease stage 4-5
Exclusion Criteria:
- Covid-19 during last 12 months. Dementia or other reason why cannot participate like major depression, psychosis or severe frailty.
